name: Fair Trade Certified
description: Standards around fair wages, safe working conditions, and community development funds.

name: Rainforest Alliance
description: Focuses on biodiversity, climate, and livelihoods across agriculture and forestry.

name: B Corp Certification
description: Assesses overall social and environmental impact; requires legal accountability.

name: GOTS (Global Organic Textile Standard)
description: Organic fiber standard with environmental + social criteria across the supply chain.

name: FSC
description: Responsible forest management for wood/paper products.

name: OEKO-TEX Standard 100
description: Tests textiles for harmful substances.

name: Cradle to Cradle
description: Multi-criteria product standard (material health, circularity, energy, water, social).

name: Clean Clothes Campaign
description: Global network improving working conditions and empowering workers in garment and sportswear industries.

name: CanopyStyle
description: Initiative to keep ancient and endangered forests out of viscose and other MMCF supply chains.

name: Better Cotton (BCI)
description: Program to make global cotton production better for farmers, the environment, and the sector’s future.

name: bluesign
description: Audits textile inputs and processes for chemical safety and environmental health.

name: Soil Association Organic
description: UK organic certification with high standards for animal welfare and no GM or artificial preservatives.

name: WRAP
description: Worldwide Responsible Accredited Production—factory certification focused on lawful, humane, and ethical manufacturing.

name: Responsible Wool Standard (RWS)
description: Assures wool comes from farms with progressive land management and responsible animal treatment.

name: Nordic Swan Ecolabel
description: Nordic official ecolabel reducing lifecycle environmental impact across product/services categories.

name: ZQ Merino
description: Ethical wool standard covering animal welfare, environmental care, social responsibility, and fiber quality.

name: SA8000
description: Auditable social accountability standard for decent working conditions and management systems.

name: Caregora
description: Welfare and quality seal for angora; focuses on responsible harvesting and animal living conditions.

name: Leather Working Group (LWG)
description: Leather supply-chain certification with environmental performance audit protocols for tanneries.

name: Carbon Trust
description: Certifications and services to measure, manage, and reduce carbon footprints.

name: Responsible Down Standard (RDS)
description: Ensures down/feathers come from animals not subjected to unnecessary harm; traceability and welfare focused.

name: Fair Wear
description: Improves labor conditions in garment factories via brand commitments and factory engagement.

name: American Grassfed
description: Standards for animals humanely raised on pasture; supports pasture-based farms and ranches.

name: BPI Certified Compostable
description: Third-party verification that products meet compostability standards and are independently tested.

name: Blue Angel
description: Germany’s official ecolabel—lifecycle-based criteria driving continuous environmental improvement.

name: Carbon Care Certified
description: Recognition for organizations managing and reducing greenhouse gas emissions responsibly.

name: Leaping Bunny (Cruelty Free International)
description: Global gold standard logo for products not tested on animals, with supply-chain checks.

name: Certified Naturally Grown
description: Peer-review certification for farms/beekeepers using ecologically minded practices without GMOs.

name: USDA Organic
description: U.S. national organic standard: no most synthetic pesticides, fertilizers, GMOs, or ionizing radiation.

name: Audubon International
description: Environmental certification programs for properties and communities to improve resource stewardship.

name: Best Aquaculture Practices (BAP)
description: Seafood certification across environmental, social, food safety, and animal health & welfare.

name: Certified Vegan
description: Verification that products contain no animal ingredients or byproducts and are not tested on animals.

name: Animal Welfare Approved (AGW)
description: High-welfare farm certification by A Greener World; promotes pasture-based systems and humane slaughter.

name: ENERGY STAR
description: U.S. EPA energy-efficiency certification for products, homes, and buildings.

name: Green Seal
description: Independent certification for products/services meeting rigorous health, sustainability, and performance criteria.

name: Wildlife Friendly
description: Standards that incentivize protection of biodiversity and support rural communities via market recognition.

name: Bird Friendly (Smithsonian)
description: Coffee grown under rigorous shade and habitat criteria to protect migratory birds and wildlife.

name: Carbonfree
description: Program to calculate, reduce, and offset carbon footprints; logo indicates participation and offsets.

name: Climate Registered (The Climate Registry)
description: Recognizes organizations that measure and publicly report GHG emissions with verified inventories.

name: LEED
description: Green building rating system by USGBC with levels (Certified–Platinum) across multiple building types.
